While I believe that hl2 is the better game. it still is rather good, the problem is that I was going in like the doom slayer for every fight. don't make the same mistake. I made it all the way to Xen playing like this and only after looking it up i realised that i was playing the game wrong the entire time. But make no mistake, as a member of Gen Z this is 8 out of 10 by FPS standards. By valves standards it about a 7, flawed but fun

Overall, I enjoy Half Life and recommend it, assuming that you play it right

What are you doing? Stand up, Degenerate. Did you forget? The reason why you're here. Isn't it to get revenge for your little salary which was eaten by developers? For your fellow comrades, for Discounts, for Achievements... You have to play them. And keep going forward. Even if you die, and even after you die. This is... the story... that you started, isn't it?
fuck yeah this games fucking rocks my guy!

So after all these years having played games like Team Fortress 2, Portal and its sequel, Left 4 Dead 2, and Garry's Mod, I finally sat down to play the game that started it all: Half-Life. Needless to say by the score, I enjoyed it.

The game provides an interesting and satisfying blend of puzzle solving, platforming, and combat, all of which was satisfying to complete for the most part. Admittedly, there are parts of the game where I needed to cheat a little because I was provided with less than sufficient resources to get past certain areas (or maybe I'm just not the best with these kinds of games, but no matter), but nonetheless this game's age truly shows in its difficulty and its occasional bugs. However, this doesn't mean it's not worth coming back to play Valve's claim to fame, because in the end, it was still a fun game with a good story to it. I look forward to playing Half-Life 2 when I have the time to.
